TopicTitle: [1.0.5] [RELEASE 0.8] Sido's Urania System : 7 new planets and 8 moons !

Articles.Content:
It would be great to have all pertinent information for all of the new bodies. Things like the gravitational parameter(s), rotational info, physical stuff (diameter) etc....

Really like this mod and look forward to any and all info for the new stuff.

thanks.

man would love to use this mod, but right now I have so many that my game crashes on load every once in a while, and when it does it will crash every time after that until I delete my crash dump folder, so Im already pretty much filled up

hey, i don't see new planet to science archives window.

anybody see new planet to science archives window?

hey, i don't see new planet to science archives window.

anybody see new planet to science archives window?

Its a known Bug with planetfactory and planetfactory CE.

Some news of the next update which (normally) will come tomorrow :

- Hermes doesn't exist anymore, i replace it by Erato

- Hestia, Ares and Rhea have been completely revamped (Atmosphere height change, gravity and best design and more realistic ground)

- Hyperion is now more large and more far away than before

- Some people feedback problem with the craters of Fragum and Crios, so i revamped them the best as i can

- a lot of little changes in the clouds

Some news of the next update which (normally) will come tomorrow :

- Hermes doesn't exist anymore, i replace it by Erato

- Hestia, Ares and Rhea have been completely revamped (Atmosphere height change, gravity and best design and more realistic ground)

- Hyperion is now more large and more far away than before

- Some people feedback problem with the craters of Fragum and Crios, so i revamped them the best as i can

- a lot of little changes in the clouds

http://i.imgur.com/sAzYloa.png

Looking forward to it. I still have 1 probe in the system, I hope it survives the changes. Also, wondering what will happen to my flags!

My Dres mining station is almost up and running, so I'll be staging from there next time round.

Looking forward to it. I still have 1 probe in the system, I hope it survives the changes. Also, wondering what will happen to my flags!

My Dres mining station is almost up and running, so I'll be staging from there next time round.

I'm advice you don't send anything to hermes anymore ^^

Rhea and Ares are too important to been totally redesigned. I made them more realistic.

Hestia as been totally revamped, it's a totally new planet, with a different ground, a different bump map and all. I just keep the "green" atmosphere

and normally by reload your quicksaving with F9 you keep all the ship on the other bodys, so it will be cool

Edited February 17, 2014 by Sido

WHy did you removed hermes?

Also if i may suggest something, change names of phobos and deimos.

It feels pretty strange to give real life astronomy names to ksp planets.

WHy did you removed hermes?

Also if i may suggest something, change names of phobos and deimos.

It feels pretty strange to give real life astronomy names to ksp planets.

Well, because i'm the pack creator so i do what i want

And she give more problems than benefits, and it's better to leave hyperion alone on its orbit but i doesn't want to remove Erato.

For phobos ans deimos, i keep the name because they're the twos mars moon and Ares ils actually a terraformed mars.

Also ThÃƒÂ©mis, RhÃƒÂ©a, hyperion etc... also exist in the solar system.

Is there an aurora australis, as well?

I like the look of these planets, quite surreal. Unfortunately, I am out of RAM.

Is there an aurora australis, as well?

I like the look of these planets, quite surreal. Unfortunately, I am out of RAM.

Yes the aurora's clouds have both austral and boreals aurora.

For the ram, if you follow exactly the first page installation, you can run this pack without any problems
question how do I get the clouds to work from the surface they work from map view but not on the surface?.
make sure the entry for them are in the user clouds .cfg i put it in both but think only need to be in the user cloud.cfg

I'm advice you don't send anything to hermes anymore ^^

Rhea and Ares are too important to been totally redesigned. I made them more realistic.

Hestia as been totally revamped, it's a totally new planet, with a different ground, a different bump map and all. I just keep the "green" atmosphere

and normally by reload your quicksaving with F9 you keep all the ship on the other bodys, so it will be cool

I'm pretty sure I put a flag on the moon of Hermes, but I haven't landed on any of the large moons (due to too little thrust).

I really want to land on Hestia and Rhea, they just look so nice. Even if there are problems with anything I have in the system currently, it's not a big problem, since all live Kerbals have left the system and are on their way home.
Quick question, I'm trying to do atmosphere on a planet. how does that work?

Quick question, I'm trying to do atmosphere on a planet. how does that work?

You can ask on the PlanetFactory CE thread. But, as we already say, you can't edit the color atmosphere and color ocean yet.

If not don't worry

Has the FAR issues been fixed yet?

question how do I get the clouds to work from the surface they work from map view but not on the surface?.

Okay, I have been having the same problem, and its really bugging me as to why its happening. I don't know if it's just me and something is screwed up with my file set up. Or you just cant see Clouds from the surface yet.

But I can see the clouds perfectly from space, But as soon as I go to the surface, I cannot see them and they become invisible, I have the Sentar expansion pack for Planet factory and there are no problems at all, I can see clouds from space and the surface. But with Urania system I cant see clouds from the surface but can from space. Can someone shed some light onto this?
Sorry if this is off-topic, but what mod gave you that command module?
its HGR roket parts spud pod

Also one additional thing, I downloaded the new update today, and the Sentar Expansion pack's Clouds are no longer working.
